title: Sudden FPS loss on Macbook Pro Late 13
body:
My ms stays steady at <45ms but I'm used to seeing an uncapped framerate of 130+... my last two aran games with nothing else running and I'm seeing less than 20 fps... sometimes under 10.

Anyone know what causes this?

replies.body:
Thanks for the reply although I'm pretty sure I've pinpointed the issue.

I have a MBP with LoL installed on OSX Mavericks, but I also have a separate bootcamp partition with Windows 7 Pro installed. Now this makes no sense at all but it seems like the fan controller I installed will sometimes disable my fans when I switch back to OSX from W7 when I have that particular program closed before restarting in OSX. When I restart with the Mac's Fan Control Running, my fans function normally when returning to OSX and I can play LoL with no FPS issues.

Like I said, it makes no sense whatsoever given that they are separate partitions entirely and one does not run while the other is running, but I've tested this and I'm 100% sure that this is my issue. Strange, but it is what it is I suppose, despite defying logic lol.

Wow.

Damn, that is pretty weird actually.  I'm not even entirely sure I would ever think of something along those lines, but I'm very happy to hear you believe you found the root cause!  Hopefully it shouldn't be an issue in the future :)

If you have any future issues, don't hesitate to make another thread here on Help and Support!

Given that your FPS dropped so drastically, there definitely seems like something is causing it to drop.  Since it can be fairly difficult to find the root cause, make sure to complete all of the steps in our [FPS Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684).  It has some of the most common solutions that should resolve this type of issue.

If you are still getting the same drops, make sure to reply back and let me know!

I discovered it because as I was playing with a buddy during the FPS loss, he suggested that my fans may have gone out. Noting that I actually couldn't hear them, when normally with this version of MBP that's all you hear, I immediately thought to test and see if they were broken by switching to my bootcamp partition because Windows doesn't do a good job of managing the Mac fans when you play some graphic intensive games like SWTOR or Fallout: NV with heaps of texture mods, which is what got me to manually control them on the Windows side anyway.

I am absolutely puzzled as to why this would carry over to OSX partition either way. Is there some sort of BIOS equivalent on the Mac hardware that could be affected by manually controlling the fans through third party software in windows?

Not that I'm not happy I can play normally again, or that it takes no longer than 10 seconds to reboot on either OS with this machine, I just really thought that changes made in a separate partition shouldn't carry over no matter what.

It's just puzzling, despite knowing that this seems to be how my laptop works now.
